<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="sys_script_fix">
    <sys_script_fix action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE">
        <before>false</before>
        <description>Script to update the dictionary entry of business app table of type collection to global scope. This is done only if the scope of business app table  is global. </description>
        <name>Fix scope of Business App dictionary</name>
        <record_for_rollback>false</record_for_rollback>
        <script><![CDATA[var isTableInGlobalScope = false;
var gr = new GlideRecord('sys_db_object');
gr.addQuery('name','cmdb_ci_business_app');
gr.query();
if (gr.next())
	if (gr.getValue('sys_scope')== 'global')
		isTableInGlobalScope = true;
//If table is only in global scope we need to check for sys dictionary entry
//else no issue as table and dictionary entry will be in apm scope anyway.
if (isTableInGlobalScope){
	gs.info('Fix scope of Business App dictionary: Business App table in Global Scope');
	//Query the dictionary entry for business applications table 
	//of type collection that is in apm scope
	gr = new GlideRecord('sys_dictionary');
	gr.addQuery('name','cmdb_ci_business_app');
	gr.addQuery('internal_type','collection');
	gr.addQuery('sys_scope.scope','sn_apm');
	gr.query();
	if (gr.next())
	{
		gs.info('Updating the scope of sys_dictionary entry with sys_id '+gr.sys_id +' to global scope');
		gr.sys_scope = 'global';
		gr.update();
	}
}
else
	gs.info('Fix scope of Business App dictionary: Business App table in APM Scope. No changes needed.');]]></script>
        <sys_class_name>sys_script_fix</sys_class_name>

</record_update>
